alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 2:37AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Impacts to the Friday Morning Commute... Strong southwest to west winds, with gusts of between 40 to 70 mph, are expected to persist through the Friday morning commute along the Rocky Mountain Front. In addition to strong cross winds travelers should be prepared for the potential of blowing and drifting snow, especially in prone areas. Some routes that could see blowing and drifting snow include but are not limited to United States Highway 2 between East Glacier and Browning, Duck Lake Road between Browning and Babb, and United States Highway 89 between Browning and the junction of Montana Highway 44. Be prepared for changing conditions over short distances. Allow extra time to reach your destination and use low beam headlights in areas of reduced visibility.

area.areaDesc: East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
